intro: Lasiocephalus caldasensis, commonly known as the Caldasensis hairhead, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rounded leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
